TopicTitle: The Best Mods To Make The Game Beautiful

Articles.Content:
Here Share your Opinions about mods to make KSP Beautiful

Here's My Opinion:

-Stock Visual Enhancement + Environmental Visual Enhancement

-Scatterer

-Distant Object Enhancement

-PlanetShine

-Real Plume

-Texture Replace (Texture Replacer Replaced too) + Skybox (Any)

-Hot Rockets

Ven's Stock Revamp makes all parts look more realistic.

Edited January 7, 2018 by NSEP

I personally use the spectra pack (Oh my god its so nice... thank you Avera9eJoe) which has a good number of the things listed. I don't use RealPlume though - it kills performance. Pretty, but kills performance.

Hot rockets is not a mod I've heard of before...

textures unlimited, ks3p (version 2.0 works best atm)

Edited January 7, 2018 by Agustin

if we disregard all performance concerns...

scatterer, AVP, Ven's stock revamp, texture replacer with Bentley's Mash-up color suits, and TexturesUnlimited(as long as you dont go too crazy with it).

Edited January 8, 2018 by DeltaDizzy
Stock Visual Enhancements with KS3P....at which point my 2.5 GHz Dual-Core CPU decides to lag out the game...

Ven's stock revamp

Scatterer... Well, I had to take time to consider using it. It does makes the game more beautiful, and my computer can run KSP with it, but since I'm a type of player who's interested in more part mods, using it with part packs makes the game performance plunmets. I use it when playing stock. EVE, SVE, and others is a no go since my computer cannot handle anything more than scatterer

 

Edited January 8, 2018 by ARS
This discussion of add-ons has been moved to Add-on Discussions.
I never have actually used any visual mods, I think they will lower my FPS significantly.
